page.title: 19VILLAGE HISTORY CONT
page.content: A SADDLERY, A HARD-WEAR SHOP AND THE COOPERATIVE STORES. FOR RECREATION, THERE WAS QUOITS ON THE GREEN AND THE CRICKET AND FOOTBALL CLUBS. THE LOCAL DANCE BAND PLAYED FOR DANCING IN THE SCARTH HALL. THE WOMENS INSTITUTE CAME INTO BEING IN 1939. FROM THE 1950'S, THERE WERE MANY CHANGES IN LIVING AND WORKING CONDITIONS. ELECTRICITY WAS INSTALLED IN MOST HOUSES WICH MEANT GREAT CHANGES IN LIGHTING, COOKING AND HEATING. STRICTER MEASURES IN HYGIENE MEANT THAT FOOD WAS MORE STRICTLY CONTROLLED. FOR EXAMPLE, MILK WAS NO LONGER DELIVERED FROM A CAN AND MEASURE, BUT IN SEALED BOTTLES. THE OLD EARTH CLOSETS DISAPPEARED AS PEOPLE WERE ENCOURAGED BY LOCAL GRANTS TO INSTAL BATHROOMS AND FLUSH LAVATORIES. TRACTORS HAD DISPLACED HORSES FOR USE ON FARMS AND WORKERS HAD TO LEARN THE NEW AND MODERN METHOD
